text: The Collège Stanislas also known as Stan, is a highly selective private Catholic school in Paris, located on "Rue Notre-Dame-des-Champs" in the 6th arrondissement. It has more than 3,000 students, from preschool to classes préparatoires (classes to prepare students to enter the elite grandes écoles such as École Polytechnique, CentraleSupélec, ESSEC Business School, ESCP Business School and HEC Paris), and is the largest private school in France.Le collège Stanislas Stanislas is considered one of the most prestigious and elite French schools.Les 10 lycées d’élite les plus primés au Concours général 2018 The school was ranked first in 2019 for high school.Découvrez le classement 2022 des meilleurs lycées du Figaro ==Former students== * Jacques Cousteau, a French naval officer, explorer, ecologist, filmmaker, innovator, scientist, photographer, author and researcher who studied the sea and all forms of life in water * Anatole France, a French poet, critic, and novelist ==References== Category:1804 establishments Category:1800s establishments in France Category:Colleges and universities in France Category:Schools in Paris
title: Collège Stanislas de Paris
